aboutSleepHealth.title: About Sleep Health
aboutSleepHealth.subtitle: Understanding sleep apnea and why treatment matters

whyMatters.title: Why Sleep Health Matters
whyMatters.p1: Sleep is not a luxury—it's a fundamental pillar of health. Quality sleep affects every aspect of our lives, from physical health and mental clarity to emotional well-being and daily performance.
whyMatters.p2: In America, sleep deprivation has reached epidemic proportions. Millions of adults struggle with sleep disorders, yet many remain undiagnosed and untreated. The consequences extend far beyond feeling tired—untreated sleep disorders can lead to serious health complications, reduced quality of life, and even premature death.

whatIs.title: What is Sleep Apnea?
whatIs.p1: Sleep apnea is a serious sleep disorder where breathing repeatedly stops and starts during sleep. The most common type, obstructive sleep apnea (OSA), occurs when throat muscles intermittently relax and block your airway. This leads to fragmented sleep, reduced oxygen levels, and numerous health consequences if left untreated.
whatIs.p2: Each time your breathing stops, your brain briefly wakes you up to restart breathing—often so briefly you don't remember it. This cycle can repeat hundreds of times per night, preventing you from reaching the deep, restorative stages of sleep your body needs.

osa.title: Obstructive Sleep Apnea (OSA)
osa.desc: The most common form (90%+ of cases), caused by physical blockage of the airway. Risk factors include obesity, age, anatomical factors, and family history.

csa.title: Central Sleep Apnea (CSA)
csa.desc: Less common, occurs when the brain fails to send proper signals to muscles that control breathing. Often associated with heart failure, stroke, or high altitude.

complex.title: Complex/Mixed Sleep Apnea
complex.desc: A combination of both obstructive and central sleep apnea.

symptoms.title: Common Symptoms
symptoms.subtitle: If you experience any of these symptoms, you may have sleep apnea:

healthRisks.title: Health Risks of Untreated Sleep Apnea
healthRisks.subtitle: Left untreated, sleep apnea can lead to serious health complications

treatment.title: Treatment Options
treatment.subtitle: Effective treatment can dramatically improve your health and quality of life

cpap.title: CPAP Therapy (Gold Standard)
cpap.description: Continuous Positive Airway Pressure is the most effective treatment for moderate-to-severe sleep apnea, with 90%+ effectiveness when used correctly.

alternatives.title: Alternative Therapies
alternatives.description: For mild cases or when CPAP is not suitable, other options may be considered.

approach.title: K-Sleep Care's Approach
approach.description: We focus on CPAP therapy as the gold standard treatment, combined with personalized care, custom mask fitting, and comprehensive 90-day support to ensure your success.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about our program

items.question: What is sleep apnea?
items.answer: Sleep apnea is a serious sleep disorder where breathing repeatedly stops and starts during sleep. The most common type, obstructive sleep apnea (OSA), occurs when throat muscles intermittently relax and block your airway. This leads to fragmented sleep, reduced oxygen levels, and numerous health consequences if left untreated.

items.question: How do I know if I have sleep apnea?
items.answer: Common signs include loud snoring, gasping for air during sleep, morning headaches, excessive daytime sleepiness, difficulty concentrating, and mood changes. However, only a sleep study can definitively diagnose sleep apnea. Schedule a free consultation to assess your symptoms.

items.question: Why should I choose K-Sleep Care over traditional US treatment?
items.answer: K-Sleep Care offers: 5 days vs. 12-18 months for complete treatment, 90%+ adherence success vs. 50% industry average, custom mask fitting vs. basic sizing, 90 days of remote support vs. minimal follow-up, transparent pricing vs. insurance uncertainty, and personalized care vs. fragmented system.

items.question: How long is the program?
items.answer: The intensive program in Seoul is 5 days. You'll then receive 90 days of remote monitoring and support after returning home, for a total of approximately 3 months of comprehensive care.

items.question: What's included in the 5-day program?
items.answer: Everything you need for successful treatment: comprehensive sleep assessment & diagnosis, AI-powered treatment planning, custom CPAP mask fitting (2 masks), CPAP machine (yours to keep), 3-month supply of accessories, daily hands-on training, supervised first night with CPAP, take-home support kit, and 90-day remote monitoring setup.

items.question: Do I need to speak Korean?
items.answer: No. All K-Sleep Care staff are fluent in English, and all materials are provided in English. Our founder and many team members are American or have extensive international experience.

items.question: How do I get to Seoul?
items.answer: We provide guidance on flight booking (major carriers from US hubs), visa requirements (most US citizens can enter visa-free for 90 days), airport pickup options, and transportation within Seoul.

items.question: Where will I stay?
items.answer: You'll need to arrange your own accommodation for the 5-day program. We provide a curated list of nearby hotels at various price points, serviced apartments for longer stays, and tips on neighborhoods and transportation.

items.question: How much does the program cost?
items.answer: Our all-inclusive package pricing is transparent and typically 30-50% less than comparable care in the US, even before considering the time savings and superior outcomes. Contact us for current pricing.

items.question: Do you accept insurance?
items.answer: K-Sleep Care is currently out-of-network for US insurance plans. However, many patients receive 30-70% reimbursement by submitting superbills. We provide all necessary documentation for reimbursement, our team assists with the insurance submission process, and all services are FSA/HSA eligible.

items.question: Is CPAP the only treatment option?
items.answer: CPAP is the gold standard for moderate-to-severe sleep apnea with the highest success rate (90%+ effective). Alternative treatments like oral appliances or surgery are less effective and have more limitations. We focus on CPAP because it delivers the best outcomes, and our program is specifically designed to overcome the adherence challenges that cause many patients to quit.

items.question: What are the side effects of CPAP?
items.answer: Common initial side effects include mask discomfort (solved with custom fitting), dry mouth/nose (humidifier helps), nasal congestion (temporary, manageable), claustrophobia (multiple mask styles available), and pressure adjustment period (gradual ramp-up). Most side effects resolve within 1-2 weeks, and our 90-day support program helps you manage any issues.

stillHaveQuestions.subtitle: Our team is here to help. Book a free consultation to discuss your specific needs.

story.title: Our Story
story.p1: After 20+ years in healthcare and witnessing countless patients struggle with the broken US sleep apnea system, we knew there had to be a better way. K-Sleep Care was born from a simple question: What if we could compress 18 months of fragmented care into 5 days of intensive, personalized treatment?
story.p2: Founded in 2025, K-Sleep Care emerged from the Antler Korea accelerator program (Cohort 7), where our vision of transforming sleep apnea treatment through medical tourism and technology innovation took shape.
story.p3: Our first corporate client, Bayer Korea, launched in November 2025, validating our approach and demonstrating the demand for better sleep health solutions.

reasons.title: World-class medical infrastructure
reasons.description: Seoul is home to some of the world's most advanced healthcare facilities and medical professionals.

reasons.title: Advanced healthcare technology adoption
reasons.description: Korean healthcare systems are early adopters of cutting-edge medical technology, including AI-powered diagnostics and personalized treatment approaches.

reasons.title: Efficient, patient-centered care culture
reasons.description: The Korean healthcare model emphasizes efficiency without compromising quality, ensuring patients receive comprehensive care in minimal time.

reasons.title: Cost-effective excellence
reasons.description: High-quality care at a fraction of US costs, making world-class treatment accessible to more patients.

reasons.title: Strategic location
reasons.description: Easily accessible from the US and Asia, making it an ideal destination for medical tourism.
